result.execSummary:
The defendant Crystal S McThune was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating w/ PAC (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid as a condition of probation.

Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for City of Waukesha Police Dept. 
  Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Cases 20CM1708, 20CM2201, 20CT180, 21CM1537 and 22CM217 were dismissed and read in.
  Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber. Release for standard conditions. May earn good time. Commencing forthwith. Sentence credit of 46 days were granted.

records.addlTxt:
11:51 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Charlie Hoffman, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Crystal S McThune in court with attorney Eryn M Menden.   
State has complied with Victim's rights. 
Case called for plea and sentencing in 20CM1499, 20CM1708, 20CM2201, 20CT180, 21CM1537, 22CM167, 22CM217.
State files an Amended complaint in 20CM1499. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of Amended complaint and waives reading.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.

Case is renumbered to 22CF795.
The defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.
Court finds the defendant knowingly, freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their right to a preliminary hearing and finds probable cause to bind over the defendant over for trial.
Information filed.    Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

State places global offer on the record.
Court conducts plea colloquy.

In case 22CM167:
  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Counts 3-5.  Court finds defendant guilty.
  Counts 1,2, & 6-10 are Dismissed and read in.

In case 22CF795:
  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Amended Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.
  Counts 2-4 are Dismissed and read in.

Cases 20CM1708, 20CM2201, 20CT180, 21CM1537, and 22CM217 are Dismissed and read in.

State and Defense make sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statement to the court.

The Defendant was sentenced to the following:
In case 22CM167:
COUNT 3:
60 DAYS in the Waukesha County Jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions). 
60  DAYS CREDIT.

FINE: $1,494  , includes IID surcharge; 
DNA SURCHARGE:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department. 
To be paid as a condition of probation in 22CF795 or civil judgment entered as penalty for non payment.

D/L REVOCATION: 18 months;
IGNITION INTERLOCK: 18 months;

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.
Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel in Waukesha County within 6 months.

***********************
COUNT 4: 
JAIL:  60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions). Concurrent to Count 3.
60  Days Credit.

Costs:  Waived by the Court, 
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a condition of probation in 22CF795 or civil judgment entered as penalty for non payment.

***********************
COUNT 5:
JAIL:  60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions). Concurrent to Count 3.
60  Days Credit.

Costs:  Waived by the Court, 
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a condition of probation in 22CF795 or civil judgment entered as penalty for non payment.

***********************
In case 22CF795:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  3 YEARS; 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia;
*Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done;

CONDITION TIME: 60 Days in the Waukesha County Jail w/Huber (all standard release conditions).
46  Days Credit. Defendant to earn good time. 

D/L REVOCATION: 30 months.
IGNITION INTERLOCK: 30 months.

FINE: $1,519, includes IID surcharge; 
DNA SURCHARGE:  $250
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to City of Waukesha Police Department. 
Payment of all Fees/Fines/Surcharges are a condition of probation and are to be converted to civil judgment for non-payment.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 12, 2022 at 11:30 am.

  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
